item.title: Thonfoxer90 - C64 Brothers
item.description:
An 8-bit rendition of a big band jazz standard from the 40's (Four Brothers by J.Giuffre ). This is the first chiptune I've made, using Renoise tracker and Unknown64, DrSid VSTis and some samples. I've got a full arrangement of the original tune ; I couldn't have made the song without it !!! It takes me a lot of work (4 months) to complete it.
I think there are some flaws to fix (particularly mixing IMO) . Any constructive suggestions is welcomed.
I hope you'll enjoy it.
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial Share Alike (BY-NC-SA)
item.itunes:author: Thonfoxer90
item.itunes:summary:
An 8-bit rendition of a big band jazz standard from the 40's (Four Brothers by J.Giuffre ). This is the first chiptune I've made, using Renoise tracker and Unknown64, DrSid VSTis and some samples. item.title: Kokoro - Zombie Pigmen (Minecraft fan music)
item.description:
Darker chiptune mixed with metal guitars and acoustic drums. Kinda what comes to mind when I think of a horde of zombie pigmen in Minecraft.
Also, since I'm new, my music background is mostly with Jungle, Drum and Bass, Trance, some soundtrack stuff recently, and have done a few chiptume like things. My other alias is Acoustiks, ive had released on Point 9 Audio and Offworld Recordings and have my music played on Bassdrive here and there.
2012 Creative Commons Copyright All rights reserved

item.title: Unicorn Dream Attack - An Offering
item.description:
I've worked on this song for weeks for the good people of this community. All sounds are from the famous Sid Chip and organized on my Akai MPC / piggy. I've been away from you for a while focusing on my beautiful family and some other music projects. I hope very much to continue to bring you music as time permits! Thank you all and please enjoy!
lyrics... You burned a hole in me down to the marrow. You found this broken heart and made it beat for you.
Oh precious Lord complete in me(the least of these). I'll be an offering throughout eternity. You're all I see.
Oh how I long for You. To see you with these eyes. Please rest your Spirit's flame. That I may have You now!
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.title: spOOked - Don Draper
item.description:
The reason you haven't felt it is because it doesn't exist. What you call love was invented by guys like me, to sell nylons. You're born alone and you die alone and this world just drops a bunch of rules on top of you to make you forget those facts. But I never forget. I'm living like there's no tomorrow, because there isn't one.
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.title: chunter - Ordinary Day
item.description:
Every day is unique, there is no such thing as an ordinary day. Ordinary Day / Concern / Turmoil / With Love We Find Relief This was a SounDevotion entry from a long time ago which I always wanted to clean up and find a way to put into a release. This is the best I could get it sounding without ruining its edge. It was made in Renoise using the draw tool and built-in effects.
It is the penultimate track on WEDDING EP, available at http://chunter.info/2012/07/04/wedding-ep
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial (BY-NC)

item.title: KurKami - Overdrive
item.description:
Hey there
this is my first track on this site :D
made in
FAMITRACKER with the Konami VRC6 expansion chip (i'm completely in love with Famitracker)
background
this tune is a little different from the music i usually make (although you don't know that yet :p ). When making this track i tried to keep the madness/chaos i usually make/have to a minimum while staying true to my own musical preferences (or at least something like that) making it a easier track to listen to
review
i don't think this is the best track i ever made (although some friends do think so) but I really like the sawtooth channel in this one. I do think this is a easy track to listen to as there are not that many things happening in it and no random switch moments
would really like to here people opinions and if i should upload some older tracks
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial Share Alike (BY-NC-SA)

item.title: Tristan White - I Thought Konami Was Cool
item.description:
Yeah, I know. Konami is cool, but the reason I named the song that was because I can never get the built-in instruments on the Konami VRC6 expansion chip on Famitracker to sound any good... :( They always end up sounding like poop when I use them (the instruments are two Konami square wave channels and a sawtooth channel). But, LOL! That's why.
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.title: basspuddle - Wav Goodbye
item.description:
This song is a bit different from what I usually write. It was the first time I've used the WAV channel in LSDJ in a legitemate way (Hence the track title), the first time I've used pulse channel chords, the first syncopated kick drum, stuff like that. I tried to branch out a little bit, and I like how it turned out.
2012 Creative Commons Copyright All rights reserved

item.title: EarthwormJim - WIP Dub Riff Thing
item.description:
I've been playing with sounds like these for some time although I'm now coming to the inevitable conclusion that my cart is dying, due to it's inability to multi-task in the sense of tables especially at higher tempos. This oringally started out as an attempt at a faster paced drum and bass style melody but my cart continued to freeze after the intro melody. It also tends to skip beats and miss out noise channel notes randomly, maybe I'm trying to do too much?
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.title: Wheely - Xeromancer (feat. Zeropass)
item.description:
Hey guys!
This tune is the result of a collab Zeropass and I did within the last week. We had to exchange midis between Ableton and FLStudio and used the same drum samples and ploque instruments within this project. What is the result? Listen yourself, I think we delivered something like a "Best of both Worlds" as we have some nice changes inside the tune. That's it guys, enjoy the tune!
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial Share Alike (BY-NC-SA)

item.title: spOOked - Bigmouth Strikes Again (the smiths) cover
item.description:
Heres alittle cover of the classic smiths song "bigmouth strikes again" Made with FL8 PE using samples from my own copy of LSDJ so i guess it is not truly 8bit but, is? :p idk i hate how the chip community calls it "fake bit" if it isnt off a gameboy or a old gaming device. LSDJ is a modern program.... It so happens the sounds are from a old device its all chippy chiptunes to me. 4 channels? fuck that! nahh unlimited channels!
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.title: Kittenrock - Virtual Kikumoto Preview (Acid Compilation)
item.description:
www.kittenrock.co.uk
Ten esteemed chipmusic composers working on ten different computers come together with one aim – to wring pure ACID from their respective platforms.
The results demonstrate what various soundchips are capable of and, more importantly, rock the house. This is Virtual Kikumoto.
01 – Yerzmyey – Get Mad (Sinclair ZX Spectrum) 02 – Kplecraft – Shibatom (Nintendo Famicom) 03 – gwEm – 1990s Superbike (Atari ST) 04 – Linde – Beige Boxes (Sega Mega Drive) 05 – Joss Manley – Acid Chunks (Commodore Amiga) 06 – Goto80 – Acid Booger (Commodore 64) 07 – Matt Nida – Save The Date (Sony PSP) 08 – Jellica – Moving House and Decorating Acid Two (Nintendo Game Boy) 09 – Hizmi – DRTY PWDR (Sharp X68000) 10 – DS-10 Dominator – After the Afterparty (Nintendo DS)
(bonus track: Ikuma – TRibe 727 (Nintendo Game Boy and Roland TR-303)
Artwork: Raquel Meyers
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.title: Shiru - Ion Storm
item.description:
Another unreleased song from 2010. Again, not a real chiptune, but it uses VOPM (chip emulator) as main synth. It is a song of the 'never feels good enough for release' kind - it lies around for years, taking random tweaks from time to time, and the only way to finish it is to release as is, which is probably better than not release it at all.
Psycle, VOPM, ErsDrums. CC-BY.
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial (BY-NC)

item.title: mo. - Uncharted Worlds - Mass Effect Cover
item.description:
Story: make cover of Uncharted Worlds from Mass Effect; send to Sam Hulick; Sam goes crazay, posts it to BioWare + to his Facebook wall; people on Sam's wall go crazy; BioWare post it on their Facebook wall; receive over 800 likes + lots of props; noone ever remembers me; foreveralone.jpg
Recorded with 2x DMG-01, 2x LSDJ, 1x shitty old Numark mixer, no EQ, no FX added.
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.title: GRaVITY2DX - Then and Now
item.description:
I'm baaack. This track was basically started almost a half a year ago maybe longer, dug it out of the old forgotten "work in progress folder" as it was labled "shit". Decided to go back to it and hear what was started, and thought it was 'do-able' so I did it. Then now its kinda like listening to a story from when I was still learning how to do what to what I now know but then it shifts back and forth...i dunno. I like it, so thats that. The name is still undecided so i called it "Then and Now:The adventure continues"
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.title: MegaMantra - Acousticophobia
item.description:
The fear of noise. Thus follows a great deal of noise.
In all honesty, I don't like making EDM, for a number of reasons. But this just sort of poured out of me last night and I thought it turned out alright. Let me know what you think, I'm always open to constructive criticism - feel free to tear me a new one if you can tell me exactly why I deserve it, because then maybe next time I won't.
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

If it ain't Baroque, don't fix it.

item.title: 9-Heart - Sweet Dream Sequence
item.description:
Hey there, after posting it on SoundCloud, my BandCamp and as a feature on the Prism Monthly MP3 Magazine i decided also to put it here, 'cause most of my posted content here is kinda shitty. I guess? This Version is slightly edited, the Original Version on my BandCamp in fact has no mastering or editing at all, 'cause the rules of the LSDJ Showdown (which the song was made for) demanded so. The track will be also featured in a alternated version ('cause this one was kinda rushed after the first version got corrupted and the need to make a second one) on my upcoming EP, which will feature more kinda "Instrumental" LSDJ Tracks. So stay tuned. ♫
2012 Creative Commons Copyright All rights reserved

item.title: YERZMYEY - Earport
item.description:
...and yessss - I finished it today.
And this is another song entirely made on ZX81 and ZX81 only - a UK monochrome computer from 1981.
MP3 recorded from real hardware.
This is a song for TurboSound (2 x AY). As I was making it entirely on ZX81, I wasn't able to constantly check out how both halfs of the song work together, so actually the second AY gives only some "deeper" sound this time, nothing more.
After all, I think it's a really decent sound, pretty powerful with 2 YMs/AYs.
More infos: http://chipmusic.org/forums/topic/6668/soundtracker-zx81-instruction-ayym/
PS: Thx a lot for all the soft/hardware to: Sasha2000, SirMorris, Andy Rea and Moggy (for software-ports for more stupid users like me).
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)
item.itunes:author: YERZMYEY
item.itunes:summary:
...and yessss - I finished it today.

item.title: MegaMantra - Acrophobia
item.description:
The fear of heights; by extension, the fear of rapid downward motion; thus follows a great deal of motion.
Seriously though, first track I've recorded off a DMG. It NEEDS criticism, namely two things (among anything else you can imagine): A) did the recording turn out okay, and B) did I manage to create a "full" sound with the song? As in, is it painfully obvious that I'm a noob with no idea what he's doing or does it at least come close to sounding like something you'd expect from a pro? Again, if you can tell me why I deserve it then feel free to tear me a new one.
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.title: Dr Treble - Gaia
item.description:
R lands on the Misshapen terraformed planet of Gaia, the pinnacle of human technology and sustainability as the planet had been historically challenging to terraform and nigh impossible to maintain. Now a planetary center of culture, power, and planetary beauty, the capital of the Galactic Senate had almost been voted off of Lunar Capital to move to Gaia. But he isn't here for the culture or to have a good time. He is under the careful watch of the mercenary Torvol, notorious for his affiliation with Philanthropy Inc. R recalls as his transport floats past towering skyscrapers and past gorgeous landscapes that this company had a huge hand in getting the human race to the colonies and begins wondering what they want with him.
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.title: SolarLune - Sky Highway (SunVox)
item.description:
Something that I just tooled around with for a few hours today and made with SunVox. I've recently been trying to make 'true' tracker songs that just use one pattern at a time, with a maximum of 8 channels being used at any given time, as well. This is a product of that limit, with 8 channels maximum, though most of the song it uses less. Anyway, take a listen and tell me what could improve. :)
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.title: seanmonistat - Panzram!
item.description:
Preview track from my upcoming EP "Sean Monistat is... +LET'S DISINFECT!+" Presenting a new personality and dimension to my body of work, this release finally unites my background of horrorpunk with chiptune. Nintendo DS, snarling vocals, poppy guitar, and dark lyrics combine to create threatening, yet danceable jams. Seductive, catchy, aggressive, and punk as fuck. +LET'S DISINFECT!+ is an all-out brutal attack on the world and all the jerks on it.
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.title: Skin Walker - Alors On Danse Rmx (Unmastered)
item.description:
I wrote this song in a rush for the first MegaByte that I played two months ago, and then I ventured off to try and find approval from Stromae himself. I only managed to get an e-mail for his press contact, but alas it proved unsuccessful. So here I am, not giving a shit, uploading my remix of this golden French mastermelody 'Alors On Danse'. Oh, and 1x DMG + 1x LSDJ. Au revoir.
© 2012 All rights reserved to Stromae and his producers
2012 Creative Commons Copyright All rights reserved

item.title: _-_- - nl23-muckinabout
item.description:
Just messing around with some patterns. The FM waveforms in Nanoloop 2.x makes quite a lot of noise. If I remember correctly, they are 9bit samples w/ linear 2-op fm. It's ok for shorter sounds, gets really hissy for chords. Embrace the hiss.
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.title: Aerotype - Goldenrod Game Corner (Genesis Remix)
item.description:

item.title: Pieces of Eight - Good Cop Bad Cop (Prom Queen cover)
item.description:
A cover of Prom Queen's (a side band of Leeni's) "Good Cop Bad Cop" off of her ultra swank retro-inspired album 'Night Sound.'
Although it's the shortest song on the album, the simplicity of the melody and structure really appealed to me. I wondered what it would sound like as a more upbeat 'Weezer-ish' sort of way.
Go buy her album here: http://promqueenband.bandcamp.com/album/night-sound
Do it.
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.itunes:summary:

item.title: nim - nimopl3_03(wip)
item.description:
adlibtracker2 opl3 on ymf715 SoC aka OPL3-SAx. sound chip series found on late 90s notebooks featuring an integral OPL3 component indistinguishable from the ymf262 in terms of sound apart from perhaps the artifacts produced by the yac512. in this case it's the toshiba portege 3000ct computer. were it not for the computer being from the era before proper suspend/sleep were commonplace the portege 3000 series is a hot recommendation. just look at the lean and beautiful figure of the 3000CT.
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)
item.itunes:author: nim
item.itunes:summary: adlibtracker2 opl3 on ymf715 SoC aka OPL3-SAx. sound chip series found on late 90s notebooks featuring an integral OPL3 component indistinguishable from the ymf262 in terms of sound apart from perhaps the artifacts produced by the yac512. in this case it's the toshiba portege 3000ct computer. were it not for the computer being from the era before proper suspend/sleep were commonplace the portege 3000 series is a hot recommendation. just look at the lean and beautiful figure of the 3000CT. 2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.title: gyms - journey to mt. p00penstein
item.description:
SNES .spc - My first .spc ever, submitted for BotB's WCVII...used the it2spc conversion method for composing it. I wanted to do a lot more with the arrangement and have more varied instrumentation in certain sections but damn, .spc is extremely unforgiving with the memory limit and I think the algo used by it2spc throws a bunch of extra memory junk in there as well. The alternate, memory conservative method is the mario hack mml mod and...yea, fuck that. I can write mml tunes via ppmck, but the mario mod stuff is pure bullshit. Anyway, was a bit disappointed with this in the end; didn't have time to sort out all the memory issues before the deadline.
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)
item.itunes:author: gyms
item.itunes:summary: SNES .spc - My first .spc ever, submitted for BotB's WCVII...used the it2spc conversion method for composing it. item.title: Jredd - FM Portable Album Preview
item.description:
The sequel to last year's FM-Possible is drawing ever closer to a finish. Myself, Groovemaster303. Cosmobuggi, and new comer OtakuMode (The Artist Formerly Known as Itayo FM) bring you this small sampler of things to come. item.title: Aerotype - Grand Master Duel (Genesis Version)
item.description:
This is a cover of "Grand Master Duel" (A.K.A "Grandmaster's Theme") from Pokemon Trading Card Game for Game Boy (very underrated soundtrack). This is my first time using VGM Music Maker, and I needed a challenge to get started. The second half is noticeably better in my opinion 'cause that's about when I started getting the hang of it. Still, I don't think I did the original justice, but I learned a lot making it.
Original version: http://youtu.be/Er4aDty0t_A
(Sorry for the repost, I had to fix the title and metadata as well as a mistake I made in the length of a particular section)
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.title: Auxcide - Our Departure [Nero - Me and You/Departure]
item.description:
Another chipstep remix! This time it's a combo of Nero's 'Me and You' and 'Departure'. This track is huge, I decided to go all out. It was a lot of fun to do, though. My favorite and probably best song to date. This is the pure chiptune version done on two gameboys. I'll be doing a version with my full set eventually. Once again, enjoy. :]

item.title: Dr. Treble - Moons of Gaia
item.description:
Troubled Astro-Archaeologist codenamed "R" slumbers in cryosleep on a journey from Rasha, a nearby mechanical moon of the planet Gaia, dreaming of his four man team and what they had discovered, but the memories are blocked. Something is in his mind and is disorienting him, but giving him visions of biomechs raining from temple walls and only him being able to stop them as an angel appears to him. He then awakes pre-maturely trapped in his mediuarmor excavation suit in the brig of a strange and unknown ship, as he stares out of a nearby window and watches the moon shrink slowly, he wonders what he has awoken to,
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.title: Letters are just a bunch of letters - NEW MUSIC 2012 CM.ORG STARDOM WOW I THINK I'M 4mat (feat nitro2k01)
item.description:
I'm a star, not a super star Damn I think i'm Aphex Twin I think i'm Boards of canada I think i'm Bach I think i'm Martin Ohm I think i'm Fibonacci I think my wave form is deep
."you're being boring with words..just make music".- NitroNBA2K12
"Wait so there were chipheads/musicians & young adults that have passed away in the chip community YET there's no honor the dead thread? ..LOL DIDN'T READ LOL BEYONCE MEME im in my 20's" - celsius
"Zomvor as been asleep all this time"...Duh what was i thinking...It's been YEARS..no...CENTURIES since my last upload. "zomvor" is back no new lessons just a submission. NO MORE DEEP CLUES why listen to zomvor/Z/ZERO/0 when there are 25other pieces? deep clues, From A (shhh)to Z(OOOOHHHHMMMMM) and back again. Forget all the other LETTERS in Alpha/bet...forget the other 25 pieces and names to the elaborate puzzle. "1+1=2" - nitro2k01(undserstands mathmatics better than anyone he is expert)
"zomvor is special" - nitro2k01
"CM.ORG is changing...it's on a shift and things are seaming impossible" - Anonymous CHIPMUSIC.ORG Member
______________________________________________________________________________________- -- --- - ---- -- -_______________________ -----__________ Enjoy my chiptune made on XYZ CONSOLE which cost XYZ value of $$$ and is harder than your ABC methods. I am somewhere in between...always watching ONline I do notsleep. "Until i sleep" by Henry Homesweet
THE RARE NEURAL CROSSINGS & FORMATIONS IN A SYNAPSE - "littleSCALEEEEEEE"
"Blasting off at the SPEED OF LIGHT...surrender NOW(or prepare to fight the gods)" -jessie/james
"LETTERS R JUS AYE BUNCH OF !3Tt3RZ"-CM.ORG ADMINISTRATION
2012 Creative Commons Copyright All rights reserved

item.title: 1950 D.A - Fleeting Youth
item.description:
Written/tracked,& engineered in about 50 minutes sometime in April 2012. After gusting as much as I could muster though the night it seemed that I was out of fuel, however persistence paid of around 7 in the morning and I was able to dish out this flaming pile of what I may consider...my greatest song to date! It may just be the crazy talking and this may be the worst song yet, but I love it. So crush me with some reality and tell me what it needs! Hell, if there's any song of mine your going to harp on, let it be this one so I can slap myself and make it better.
2012 Creative Commons Copyright All rights reserved

item.title: 1950 D.A - Beyond :The Salvage Threshold
item.description:
2nd song finished after my lsdj collapse in 2007. This was composed in March of 2011, the overall feeling that I was trying to convey in this song was a sense of relief and ambiance after a month of tireless job searching in one of the cities with the highest unemployment rate. However if you listen to it there is still a lot of tension, while the tempo remains slow the melody is moving faster creating a very subtle swing which still harbors feelings of irritability and anxiety when I listen to it...that's just my opinion though. I'm not completely satisfied with song and I stongly feel like it could use some improvement, I just don't know where. Constructive criticism no matter how blunt, or brutal is always appreciated!
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial Share Alike (BY-NC-SA)

item.title: 1950 D.A - Reboot From Memory
item.description:
January 2012. This is the emotional conclusion to The Rumble Pack Sister's; a song I had to split in two. Because what fellow musician in their right mind is going to sit patiently through a song with a duration of roughly 16:00 minutes only to give friendly feedback? Depends on the song I suppose.lol. It definitely wouldn't be this one though. Give me some feedback, I prefer cruel sincerity over sweet and sugar-coated.
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial Share Alike (BY-NC-SA)

item.title: Peaches the Wale - Peaches the Wale - Fiyah (Chainsaw Police's HELP I HAVE NO VSTs INSTALLED Remix)
item.description:
A remix of a pretty sexy track from Peaches/godinpants's latest EP. Used ProTracker to write the majority and added effects in FL Studio (delays, room reverbs, a little bit of EQing).
Samples taken directly from the mods godinpants provided with the album download, mainly from mod.fiyah of course :P
(also sorry that the little bursts of the Think break and the dub airhorn aren't amiga-ish enough, they weren't sampled onto the amiga. Audacity hated me that night. Instead they were dropped in while the original mixdown was in FL Studio)
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.title: p1xel sh4der - 0x00000001
item.description:
Don't get confused by my track titles. This is the very first track I ever made with LSDJ. It was initially created using a GameBoy Emulator (BGB it think it was) a few years back. Later I transferred it to a cartridge and applied some fixes so it plays nicely on the real thing. In the end, the recording was done using a real DMG-01.
This track is also available for download at LSDSNG Swap: http://lsdsng.com/song/zeug-work-title
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial Share Alike (BY-NC-SA)

item.title: VCMG - Binary Lake (SunVox+Monotron+iPhone)
item.description:
Weeklybeats 13! So I've had this app called TweakyBeat on my phone for a while but never really used it. It's a free analog drum synthesizer and sequencer, and it's pretty cool for a free app. Since I had cracked my Gameboy's screen and couldn't use it, I decided to explore Tweakybeat's possibilities a little while I'm waiting for my new DMG to arrive by making this demo (http://dl.dropbox.com/u/54383681/tweekybeatjam.mp3) with it. This was my original WB submission, but right after I uploaded it I had ideas to turn it into a full song, so I developed it into what you hear now. /end story The percussion is TweakyBeat, the bassline is a Korg Monotron, and the rest was provided by SunVox. Apologies for the wonky Monotron playing, playing in tune consistently on a ribbon keyboard is harder than I thought it would be.
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial Share Alike (BY-NC-SA)
item.itunes:author: VCMG
item.itunes:summary: Weeklybeats 13! So I've had this app called TweakyBeat on my phone for a while but never really used it. item.title: HolyNegative0 - Genesis
item.description:
Had the hardest time thinking of a name for something. Whipped this up yesterday and today. I think it's kind of cool. *shrug* Honestly, I think this is my personal best to date, but that's just my opinion. I impressed myself with the fact that I came up with some decent variation in the melody, sound, and beats, as well as that little noise section in the middle. That part was fun. :3 Anywho, I figured out how to frickin' record in stereo, finally. I love to experiment and do some fun things with panning, so maybe later I'll go back and rerecord my older songs in stereo. Who knows. Written entirely in nanoloop 1.2, recorded and mastered in Audacity, just some fades.
Please comment and critique! I'd love to get better!
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial Share Alike (BY-NC-SA)
item.itunes:author: HolyNegative0
item.itunes:summary:
Had the hardest time thinking of a name for something. Whipped this up yesterday and today. I think it's kind of cool. *shrug* Honestly, I think this is my personal best to date, but that's just my opinion. I impressed myself with the fact that I came up with some decent variation in the melody, sound, and beats, as well as that little noise section in the middle. That part was fun. :3 Anywho, I figured out how to frickin' record in stereo, finally. item.title: bryface - cheap bastard groove
item.description:
This was my first LSDJ tune (groan) from like 2-3 years ago, uploaded here for lulz and posterity. this is what happens when you do everything wrong:
- composed on an unregistered version of LSDJ. i mean, i literally was TOO CHEAP to pay johan $2. as a result, i had to do this in pretty much one sitting, and then i turned it off. song data gone, forever.
- i didn't know how to use the noise channel, so i just plain left it out, relying on WAV kits.
- i didn't have an EMS cart back then, nor did i know what one was, so the session of LSDJ was running off of lameboy GB emulator for DS. This emulator is known for royally screwing up any and all kits/samples, although i didn't know it at the time. that's why the drums sound like losers.
- good lord, stop
strangely, i still like this song, and i may remake it in the future using actual skills. don't worry, my future uploads only get better from here - new tracks coming real soon.
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial Share Alike (BY-NC-SA)

item.title: Downstate - Its hard to masturbate and laugh at the same time
item.description:
'pono background music'.......fuck me, thats the worst theme for a meloncolic bitch like myself. i guess its 70's funk or cheesey house music.....(although i saw a porn once with selected ambient works 2 by afx as the soundtrack, very distracting...kept thinking 'ah i love this tune'...no wait look at the swinging boobs and focus god dammit !......anyway thankfully i also once watched some porn, where the girl was incredibly hot...but i found it impossible to masturbate again because the soundtrack was 'the vengaboys - sex on the beach'. Its hard to masturbate and laugh at the same time. So as a homage to that, and because of the fact i couldnt be arsed to make some 70's funk porn music....i made a cheesey pathetic vengaboys homage. when i played that ridiculous lead i laughed so hard i could barely play. i tested it by trying to wank with this playing in the background. i could not maintain an erection so my job is done. Nick Maynard, walk into the next round my friend.
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.description:
LISTEN TO THE WHOLE THING SERIOUSLY, ITS WORTH IT,.. skipping through this song would make it rather lame..
From my new album that im writing here in Mexico...
the whole album is going to be extremely strange.. lots of different kinds of things in single songs.. the album has a story with complex characters in it. it's all going to be explained once you get the whole thing.. its gonna be for free. but I'm gonna sell comics, Kunaki physical copys, and T-shirts.. its seriously gonna be nuts.. alll my live performances will probably stay as simple as possible, meaning just me and LSDJ, or a laptop or something.. but eventually, I'dlike to perform with a full bad an orchestra and stuff.

item.title: DjCUTMAN - Voltage (Nice Sprite Chiptune Remix)
item.description:
A lot of people rag on Skrillex now that he's super popular grammy award winning gothic looking twenty something, but something always stuck with me about his songs. Even after the initial "wow-factor" of his trademark dubstep monster sounds wore off, I found myself remembering his melodies. Could it be that they're actually well-written pieces of music? I took the Skrillex song Voltage and re-created it with Magic 8bit, basic processing in ableton, and a heavy dose of EQ, to create this piece. The harsh and crazy nature of the original dubstep tune is replaced with the light-hearted, optimistic chiptune arpeggios and square lead. An intensely sculpted vocal sample gives the piece context, although I feel it works without. I hope you enjoy this piece as much as I enjoyed making it.
Thank to Evan Duffy for his awesome piano arrangement that I used as a reference for this chiptune, and of course thanks to Sonny Moore for the original piece.
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial Share Alike (BY-NC-SA)

A lot of people rag on Skrillex now that he's super popular grammy award winning gothic looking twenty something, but something always stuck with me about his songs. Even after the initial "wow-factor" of his trademark dubstep monster sounds wore off, I found myself remembering his melodies. Could it be that they're actually well-written pieces of music? I took the Skrillex song Voltage and re-created it with Magic 8bit, basic processing in ableton, and a heavy dose of EQ, to create this piece. The harsh and crazy nature of the original dubstep tune is replaced with the light-hearted, optimistic chiptune arpeggios and square lead. An intensely sculpted vocal sample gives the piece context, although I feel it works without. I hope you enjoy this piece as much as I enjoyed making it.
Thank to Evan Duffy for his awesome piano arrangement that I used as a reference for this chiptune, and of course thanks to Sonny Moore for the original piece. 2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial Share Alike (BY-NC-SA)

item.title: Jredd - Namco Highway
item.description:

item.title: Benindetto - The Drake Equation
item.description:
This is a fakebit chiprock track I made, and my first attempt at mixing recorded instruments (drums and bass) and chip sounds, and indeed one of my first serious recording endeavors. I am looking for constructive criticism mainly on the mixing and production, or really any other aspect of the recording. For those curious, the speech sample is from the movie This Island Earth. Also, listen for a melodic homage to a track from Kirby Super Star.
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.title: Iron Curtain - Imperatum Ad Machinas (Terror From The Skies Above)
item.description:
This is a track that will appear on my upcoming album "...And Justice For Some". The track was influenced by Danimal Cannon's "Roots", Chipzel's "Child's Play", and Derris-Kharlan's "Roboroach", among many others. The thematic subtext of this track was inspired by the unmanned aerial vehicles, or drones, that are currently attacking innocent civilians in Yemen, Afghanistan, Pakistan, et al.
2012 Creative Commons Copyright All rights reserved

item.title: nickmaynard - hashtag 2012
item.description:
http://nickmaynard.tumblr.com/post/18957716365/song-title-hashtag-2012-written-recorded
this is what two gameboys, one of which is plugged into delay, phaser, distotion, and flanger pedals, recorded on to a reel to reel recorder sounds like. more of a gear experiment than an actual jam. i’ve only spent a few days on this song but i really dig it so far. hopefully, a finished version of this (along with a few other jams) will be released in a few weeks?
2012 Creative Commons CC Attribution Noncommercial No Derivative Works (BY-NC-ND)

item.title: Kubbi - Kubbi - Stalactite ( From 8BitWorld )
item.description:
So this is one of the tracks from the game I'm working with Treesun studios on. It's called 8BitWorld.
"Everything in this game is procedurally generated and every new game is a unique experience.
8BitWorld generates a random landscape with every save file. In it's mountains, it adds caves, which upon entering; generates an entirely unique cavern. It adds randomly placed towns, each with its own diverse population. It builds a massive list of randomly generated equipment."
Download the free Demo here: http://treesun.net/games/bitworld
2012 Creative Commons Copyright All rights reserved

item.title: UncleBibby - The Long Dark Hallway
item.description:
This is one of my more unique songs. It uses an 8bit bass and 8bit-style sampled drums, but the rest of the song is made up of samples of kids who have sung on Reality TV talent competitions. Overall, I think it's one of my more eerie, more thoughtful songs. I hope you like it, I made it in Cubase Essential 5 using Plogue Chipsounds and a sampler program.
2012 Creative Commons Copyright All rights reserved
